Reviews.Title: “They should pay you not to stay at thid place”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: Looks great on the outside, this in itself must be a form of false advertising. It must be the dirtiest, untidy, poorly maintained building in London, even a fire trap. Staff on the desk are ok but behind that the management are rude and unhelpful once they have your money. Dont go thier, dont recommend it and warm your friends.

Reviews.Title: “A tip.”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: A One-Star rating is to high for this 'shed.' Avoid, at all costs! The website photos, and the entrance foyer, give an nice impression. The dream ends there. I cannot believe anyone dare offer such a disgustingly filthy place for visitors to our Capital city. The window has a hole in its wooden frame. The toilet bowl hasn't been cleaned properly for 'ages.' So that infers no-one is checking the standards of cleanliness. How sad, that a City Centre hotel is ripping off visitors/tourists. I ought to have read other reviews on this website before booking, but in haste, didn't. I was glad to get home to get a good night's sleep again, after three nights on a fold down (worn-out springs) bed. As a matter of interest, I tried to check for Olympic date bookings. None are being accepted! Beware Olympic visitors! You will think you have been allocated a storage room, which is what this room should be used for, no human habitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cost benefit”
Reviews.Author: Patriciatrips
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in London I had no where to say, after hanging around the area everything was so overpricing this hotel was like 1/4 cheaper than anyone in the area was clean had Internet the staff was nice, I liked very much and really recommend. They just don't have bathroom inside the bedroom if there is no problem, thé rest is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? More like Hostel!”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a double room at this "hotel" for a night after our 3 night stay in Venice. We booked it primarily for its location. Got there and I must say it looked lovely from the outside. Walked into the reception and again...lovely! Very clean, exactly what you see in the photos. Check-in was no problem. We were given the key to the room told how to get to it. We walked up the very narrow stairs to room 311. Opened the door to find one of the worst rooms I have ever seen in my life! The room consisted of double bed in middle of room, wash hand basin less than a foot from the bed, OUT-OF-ORDER shower, wardrobe with no door with a TV in it. No bathroom, as apparently it's "SHARED FACILITIES". The walls were grubby, the bed was not comfortable at all, and the taps were constantly dripping. Within minutes, I tried to access the "free wifi" to check other people's reviews, but couldn't get access. Using my mobile internet, we saw some pretty bad reviews. One description we saw, that I would have to agree on was "A Shelter for the Homeless". Enough said! There's a reason why most of the pictures are of the exterior and the reception. The room we were in was nothing like the pictures. I imagine those pictures were taken several years ago, and the rooms have just deteriorated over the years! Using my mobile we looked for alternative accommodation, as we could NOT stay in such meager conditions, never mind sleep there! We found the Premiere Inn round the corner. We took our valuables with us (not trusting the safety of the room) to the Premiere Inn, leaving the rest of our things in the room as they were tired of carrying all our stuff with us. After booking a nights stay at the Premiere Inn, we returned to the Belgrave to collect the rest of our belongings and check out. My girlfriend handed the receptionist our key, and said we were checking out. The man looked bewildered, as we had only checked in less than half an hour before. He asked if there was something wrong with the room, to which we replied only that we had found somewhere else, not wanting to embarrass the man. After all it wasn't his fault the room was in a poor state of cleanliness and repair. As it was booked under my girlfriend's name, he asked her to write and sign a statement to say that we checked out at no fault of the hotel. She wrote, and I loosely quote "Room 311 has checked out, due to finding more suitable accommodation. signed and dated 19th January. My girlfriend and I are 23. We may not have much experience staying in hotels, but we do have standards, and The Belgrave was not up to our standards! For £40, we weren't expecting 5* everything new and room service etc, but we did NOT expect what we experienced! Very cheap, but very poor standards! Dreary and dingy! Will NEVER be staying there. I would advise everyone to be careful with regards to this "hotel"

Reviews.Title: “Grotty”
Reviews.Author: gabriellakury
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we thought this 'hotel' looked really nice from the outside, convenient to pimlico/victoria area and modern, clean cut front and lobby. However as soon as we left the lobby we walked into what seemed to us like a £10 per night hostel. Peeling paint, tiny corridors and very dated decor continued all the way up the 5 flights of stairs we had to climb to get to our tiny room. We were allocated a cramped triple when we only needed a double, and the extra bed in the room just made it feel even smaller. The room was clean (so clean that you could smell the bleach in the bathroom!) but the walls covered in marks, damp spots on the ceilings, and again peeling paint in all the corners and coving. The tiny bathroom had a horrible 'wet room' style shower with a plastic mildew covered curtain around it and everything needed re-grouting and just a lick of paint. We are not snobby people about where we stay in hotels and generally are very happy with cheap and cheerful hotels... this hotel was indeed basic as we had expected but it just felt completely run-down and not looked after. All it would need is a paint job, new carpet and maybe the bathrooms cleaned up a bit and it would be fine for what we were paying, but for £60 a night (and that was reduced!!!) it is really not worth it! I would strongly advise you pay the extra money and go and stay in the nearby premier inn!

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: annemarie K
Reviews.Content: Please I advise you not to book with this hotel. I do not know how someone could even call this a hotel. From the outside it looks great and in a nice area. got inside and checked in we had a twin room with an ensuite, It was atrocious, ensuite was disgusting and the sink was dirty and the smell was unbearable of dirt mould and dampness. We could not even close the door in it but if we left it open too long the smell in the room would be horrendous and sickening.Thank god it was only one night. the pillow was so thin we had to put our clothes underneath it to make it feel like we had a pillow. The walls need to be painted badly and you can see where it has been replastered. The nicest part was the reception but obviously just to look good I suppose. Yes it may be cheap but I would never ever stay in a dump like that again. I read these reviews beforehand and thought it can't be that bad but YES it really is

Reviews.Title: “You get exactly what you pay for !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Lob
Reviews.Content: I really can't fault BGH given the fact that they are charging £40 for a double room in a decent area just 200m from Victoria Station - that's just incredible value. Obviously you dont get 5 star luxury but I was welcomed by a pleasant and efficient receptionist, got upgraded to an "Appartment Room" which was comprised 2 double beds, showere / wc (very small but did the job!), cooker, microwave and fridge ! I would say BHH is ideal place to stay for anyone looking for a cheap and functional place to stay in central London, but if you want pampered luxury then go elsewhere and pay for it ! I

Reviews.Title: ““worst hotel that i have ever stayed in””
Reviews.Author: Laszlo S
Reviews.Content: Everything was unacceptable. Bedroom was filthy. Bathroom poor. Shower clogged. I would never ever go there again, no recommendation to any one. I would rate this hotel a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely basic and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Suecee71
Reviews.Content: Our room was very basic and pretty run down although fairly clean. Bearing in mind the price and the fact it is in central London the room itself was ok. The main problem was the noise from outside. We were on the ground floor at the front and there was a constant stream of traffic and people passing by at all hours. We probably did not manage more than about 1 - 2 hours sleep. The room was a bit too warm and I can imagine it would be unbearably hot in the summer and there would be no way you could have the window open as the noise was excessive with it shut. The rooms could do with soundproof double glazing and some air con. If you can sleep through an earthquake and like to be very warm then this is the hotel for you, if not, best to avoid. I have reviewed the room I stayed in but my friend's room was much worse. The lowlight being 2 camp beds pushed together with a single quilt and wafer thin pillows. As there are many other hotels in the vicinity next time I will certainly try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Descent Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Belgrave House Hotel last week for a night. It is a very basic hotel with all facilities you need for a short break. Price is very good. I have booked Room 16, it was clean and tidy, slightly small but i was alone so did not mind. Staffs are really friendly and they are very efficient when you start communicating with them. I honestly had a night sleep so I do not know why all the reviews on Tripadvisor are bad. I paid under £40.00 for a room with breakfast, i cannot complaint. Will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “OMG!! absolutely discusting.”
Reviews.Author: Kim8484_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived for our w/e away and we booked this hotel online, pictures are very disieving we booked a en suite room the furniture was so old and barely surving it's purpose! we had what I would describe as a camp bed, there was a old chair in the room that was black with dirt, the shower in our room was so think with limescale it just trickled out, we had no heating and the shared toilet was awful the toilet was heavily stained and the floor was covered in hair! We booked for breakfast which consisted of tinned fruit and cereal. Have sent hotel management an email to which I have had no reply. Avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “The pits, no bedding, reminded me of a scummy bedsit”
Reviews.Author: J66lep
Reviews.Content: First concern lobby area full of about 300 black bin liners. Additional £5 charge for an iron, enquired about an ironing board and told to use table on the room; there was no table or indeed any surface to iron. Got to room and shocked to find mattress with no bedding. Was advised that was what was in the black bin liners. Was offered a sheet. I said that was unsatisfactory and was told nothing they could do and advised to put the radiator on. Curtains hanging of the track. Sink in room had clearly been used as a toilet and I could see why when I went to the toilet. Bathroom filthy. Avoid!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Online Scam!”
Reviews.Author: Apd P
Reviews.Content: Beware Online Scam! Hotel will charge you even if you will cancel your reservations and they will promise to not to charge you. Guy at reception was very confident at what he was doing, so it is looks like that they doing this scam on regular basis. Scam works simple: 1. You make reservation 2. You arrive at hotel and at hotel they will say that you reservation is cancel for some reason (mine was ID ) 3. They will charge you full room cost It is looks like a budget hotel, but it is not, it is just SCAM.

Reviews.Title: “Scam - Avoid at all costs!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Klaus H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was cheap and the location - don't get suckered in by these factors as it will end up costing you. I booked a few weeks in advance and everything seemed OK at first, until I arrived. Firstly I was shocked by disgusting smell in the lobby, maybe I had just caught them on a bad day when they were experiencing a leak somewhere so I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I went to reception to sign in and was told that I needed my passport (as do all non-UK residence) to do so, which came as a suprise as there was no mention of this in during the booking process. I didn't have my passport so was refused the room that I booked and was told that there was no way i could get a room at this hotel. I then explained the unfairness of the situation and the receptionist agreed that there would be no cancelation fee and i wouldn't be charged a penny. I left feeling angry that i was now in London without a place to stay, but atleast there was no additional fee's to pay. However, I've just got my bank statement and noticed that i have been charged the full price for a room that i didn't even stay in. I've phoned the hotel directly to discuss the matter but they've refused to talk to me and give me my money back. This crap hotel should be knocked down.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Smells, Dirty need I say anymore”
Reviews.Author: Elemental20
Reviews.Content: I would have stayed here for a short trip however I read the reviews and decided to cancel. I was feed false information about booking and cancellation fee. I have now lost my money and heard more causes of booking scams for this hotel. I have never know a Hotel to have such bad reviews, don't be fooled say your money!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel that i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: leimanley
Reviews.Content: i will never never go back to this hotel in my life i b ooked a weekend for my daughters 18th birthday the first receptionist was nice, but after that it was terrible the staff was rude ignorant, not very helpful at all. Our room was awful very basic fold up beds not even proper ones couldnt stop itching didnt smell fantastic, the en-suite well what can i say no bigger than a box and disgusting toilet black, shower not nice the water ran everywhere all over the floor into the our room. No doors on wardrobe 4 hangers there was 3 of us in one room too cramped the noise was awful from other rooms the walls too thin i will never recommend this hotel to anyone STAY AWAY..................

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have stayed in 20 years”
Reviews.Author: Nitram123
Reviews.Content: £129 for a rrom with two beds, dirty and stale smelling carpets, an electrical socket which was hanging partly from the wall, a wardrobe with both doors missing. This is, I promise, to be avoided at almost any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: radams1
Reviews.Content: If dirty walls, damp, faulty plug sockets, water damage, a broken bed, a filthy toilet and very poor service are what you are looking for, then this is the hotel for you. DO NOT BOOK!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in an ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers866
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I was not looking forward to my stay (most hotels were fully booked for the dates I wanted, so could not book anywhere else). We booked a double en suite room for 1 night to see a show in the o2. The hotel was very close to Victoria station and was very easy to find. The exterior of the hotel looked very inviting. We arrived about 2 hours before check-in as we were hoping to leave our luggage there whilst we went to do some shopping. We were informed that we could go straight to our room - which was great for us. The room was very basic but that's what we were expecting for the price. The room had a TV (not the best signal) and wifi access (which worked great!). From reading the previous reviews it seems like some people expect too much for such a low-cost hotel in central London. In summary, the hotel is great for a cheap one-night stay in a great location but I probably wouldn't choose it for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Rinne23
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel (if you can call it that) to anybody. The pictures on the website are somewhat misleading, and not a true representation of our stay! The stairs leading up to our room were filthy, and so was the room itself! There wasn't really enough space for two people, and we found ourselves falling all over each other. The bed was old and rickety, to the point that it was collapsing inwards... The only form of duvet they provided was some sort of murky brown blanket, which was very itchy and manky looking. The shared bathroom was very basic... not particularly clean either. (There was an awful lot of body hair on the floor.) The location was good, and we were able to store our suitcases there after checkout as well... Bearable for one night... just about!

Reviews.Title: “cheap but spartan”
Reviews.Author: DerHenni
Reviews.Content: Very cheap Hotel, but also very spartan. The advertised Free WiFi was not available, the bed was really short and quite small for two persons, plus rooms and bathroom looked not well maintained. Very loud street in front of the hotel and very warm central heating which can not be adjusted by the guest. Also very loud doors and floor, you can hear every guest which walks through the house. It can even wake you up. Plus the beds are not really comfortable. I wouldn't visit this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this HOLE-TEL”
Reviews.Author: tracey2586
Reviews.Content: Only good thing about this is the location. Everything else was dreadful, especially the bed bugs. The staff were unhelpful, the room and bathrooms were filthy, and there were pigeons in my ceiling. Not to mention the thin walls, noise from other guests, and bed bugs! Don't stay here, you'll regret it later!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: faizal_karim
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip... spent a few days in a number of places in the UK - the last of which was at the Belgrave House Hotel. Best location possible... just (very) short walk from Victoria station. Made life WAY easier (and cheaper). We didn't have a huge budget, so this hotel was perfect. Free breakfast in the morning, free wi-fi internet, and cheap rates. Service was good too... really helped us get to the places we wanted and made arrangements for us as well when needed. Would recommend to anyone who needs to visit London on a budget, but still wants to be where the action is at.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, friendly service, great location”
Reviews.Author: hank_walter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently as I was traveling through Europe. Very affordable, and was in the perfect location (literally seconds away from Victoria station). Friendly staff... made my stay quite comfortable, and were very helpful. Room was small, but it did the job. Breakfast was provided and it had free internet. No complaints. Would suggest to anyone looking to stay in London on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay I could imagine”
Reviews.Author: Reiner71
Reviews.Content: I'M sorry to do so but I must strongly recommend not to stay at this hotel. My first impression: A shelter for homeless. I booked an en-suite room. When checking in I was told that "the toilet is broken and cannot be repaired today". I got another room, shared bath and toilets as the hotel was fully booked. The room was approx. 5 square meters. It was dirty, very bad bed, mould and dirt in the toilets and the showers. The reception told me that I would get a reduction credited to my credit card as a compensation. I didn't get that and that's close to deception. Never ever stay at this hotel, even if you are an experienced budget traveller. Better sleep in a train station than in this hotel. I will not load up any pictures in order not to expose them to much but I think the City of Westminster's city council should close this place immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: anne09London
Reviews.Content: Whilst the rooms are cheap, you really should avoid this hotel at all costs. It is a Hostel not a hotel, no hot water, smelly room, sheets didnt fit the bed, thre list is endless. I am amazed places like this still exsist.

Reviews.Title: “do not trust”
Reviews.Author: poppysweep
Reviews.Content: they cancelled my booking when they couldn't take the money from my account before I arrived, informed me by email and when I checked what was going on they had already let the room to someone else, good job I checked the email or I wouldn't have had any accommodation when I arrived!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever seen..”
Reviews.Author: MarkHerskind
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled by the pretty front or the fancy lobby.. This hotel is old, shabby and downright disgusting.. The bed were horrible, the kitchenette were non-equiped and the bathroom/toilet were old, small and dirty. The breakfeast were sad.. Toasted bread and some vacuum packed jam.. The location is very good though and it's cheap.. I will NEVER stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “the worst bed i've ever slept in!”
Reviews.Author: katah123
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed here for two nights, we didn't expect an amazing hotel at all for the price we paid (£100 for both of us for two nights) but it was pretty poor. The bed was by far the worst thing, you could literally feel every spring in your back from the mattress, we hardly slept at all. However the room had a toilet two sinks, wardrobe and tv (poor reception tho) which was fine for us as we weren't in london to stay in the hotel but it had the basic needs. the days we went to london were hot days and when we first went into our room it was absolutely boiling! there was a fan but it was pretty crap and didn't do a lot..there was no air con here. breakfast was pretty shocking too, another review said they had fruit and yogurt etc but when we were at the hotel there was only weetabix, cornflakes and toast.. so on our 2nd day we went to a cafe and had a lovely full english instead! all in all it was ok, if the beds were better i think it would have made our trip a bit more enjoyable because we wouldn't be so tired!!! good location.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay HERE”
Reviews.Author: Moppet02
Reviews.Content: This was the worst night I have ever spent, and I have been camping and slept in the back of a station wagon on a beach in California and had more facility's. I knew there was no en suite but I did expect to have a wash basin in the room, but no the nearest one was 3 floors up even the toilet which they had one on the same floor as us did not have anything for you to wash your hands, thank god for my c lensing wipes. The room was disgusting, the beds had no padding over the springs and one of the squeaked so much my son had to share my bed with me, and the pillows were as thin as a blanket. There was a bright spot light shining in the window all night so we did not know if it was dark or if the sun had come up and the curtains were very thin and hanging off the rail. We could not wait to book out of the place and as we had had no sleep we booked out by 8:15 with out even having a wash and went to a café. If you are thinking of booking this hotel I would advise you not to spend a bit more and get some where where you can have a nights sleep and wash.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: danielle5656
Reviews.Content: I booked a 6 night stay at this hotel only because it was the cheapest option close to my destination. I booked a week in advance and called prior to the day I was supposed to check in. When I arrived at the hotel I was told I could not stay there because I did not have a passport even though I live here in the UK and had 2 forms of government ID. Nowhere on the site or here or ANYWHERE does it state that you need a passport to check in to this hotel!! I was refused check - in even though I had already paid in advance for the nights. The man at the reception desk was VERY RUDE wouldn't even let me use the phone so I could make a local call to my husband to tell him I needed my passport and had NOWHERE to sleep for the night! So in result I had to walk to a hotel next door and use their phone and pay for a extra night stay at hotel when I already had a paid for a night at Belgrave. My husband had to drive a hour the next morning to meet me and give me my passport. When I was finnally able to check in at this hotel I was disgusted with the state my room was in. Television did NOT work, very UNCLEAN, BLOOD STAINS on bedding, DUST everywhere, something that looked like feces was on the light switch, dirty foot stain on the walls! Maid never changed bedding the whole time I was there, and unkept restrooms. Told reception the t.v. wasn't working and nothing was done. This was the worst hotel stay I have ever had! DO NOT STAY HERE, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: tommylove007
Reviews.Content: I looked online to see what kind of a hotel this was and only to find that this had 1 out of 10 reviews saying it was good. All the rest were saying how rubbish the hotel was. When I arrived, I was expecting to see the hotel in bits and to have sleepless nights, nothing to be working and the staff to be rude. But it was the best stay I had in London, and would definitely go back there any day. The room was nice for a single room. It was large room and it had a soft bed, shower, toilet, sink, wardrobe, bed side table, television and free wi-fi. I couldn't have asked for more at £30 per night. The breakfast was nice too - toast, cereal, yoghurt, fruit and your choice in drinks. The staff were lovely and very helpful. There was one day when the hot water didn't work in the morning and the staff gave me another room to have a shower in and they called for maintenance to fix it within the day. I couldn't have had a better time in the hotel than I already did. This hotel was centrally located in Victoria, just two minutes walk to Victoria Station (tube - central/district and victoria lines, coach and national rail inc. Gatwick Express). Just around the corner from Buckingham Palace and minutes from the Thames River.

Reviews.Title: “Bad - Bad - Bad.”
Reviews.Author: the_dissatisfied
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with most others - it is a terribly bad hotel. In addition to this, we have seen that both our Visa card has been hacked - and they are not used both elsewhere. So besides the miserable hotel it was a further miserable experience.

Reviews.Title: “A definite no-no.”
Reviews.Author: rathvalepark
Reviews.Content: I checked in to The Belgrave House hotel at 7pm and checked out less than an hour later, I was in London to celebrate my 40th Birthday and thanks to this hotel they completely ruined my first evening. I had to find another hotel and I was told the manager was not available to speak to, I asked to speak to him on numerous ocassions during my stay in London and was told the same thing each time. I filled out a complaint form while there and the staff on reception didn't seem to care,I got the impression they were used to this happening. I found pest control under the bed, mould every where and earth wiring exposed under the sink in the so called bathroom, the bed looked like it had seen better days and curtains hanging off the walls. There was lino on the floor and a very dim light in the room ( probably there so I couldn't see how bad the room actually was) I asked the man from reception to come down to see the room and asked him would he stay in the room and he said no. The reception area is very nice but sadly is goes downhill after that, the staff were argumentative and spoke over me and my friend when we tried to speak, On 2 ocassions we were there looking for the manager another guest was complaining about no heat in her room and was repeatedly told it would be sorted and by sheer coincidence this lady was on our flight home! We spoke to her and she like us was not pleased with her accomodation or the way she was treated. If you are considering staying at this hotel be warned, Enter at your own wiil. We were fooled by the website pictures of the rooms and we argued that to reception the rooms are not what is shown on the website. We found a great hotel a few doors up The Dover Hotel, The staff were so friendly and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated and it was cheaper so maybe give it a try I will definitley be staying there again and recommending it to friends and family. Do not be fooled by the pictures of the Belgrave Hotel it is a disgrace and I dont know how they are still running a business. The only good thing going for this hotel is the location its only few minutes walk from Victoria Station.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Avoid, Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: blackdahlia
Reviews.Content: Had a job interview at very short notice and needed a cheap place near Victoria Station to crash for the night, so I booked this through lastminute.com - yes, I had read the reviews here, but I thought "could it really be that bad?" Let me tell you, it's WORSE. The one good thing is that it really is within walking distance of the station, but it's all downhill after that! The lobby is all shiny tiles and brass railings, but the 'hotel' gets progressively filthier as you go upstairs - as though the cleaning staff, assuming there are any, lose the will to live with every flight of stairs they climb. Yes, I was up on the very top floor despite requesting a ground floor room when I booked; not only are the stairs very narrow and the handrails practically non-existent, there appears to be no fire escape or fire extinguisher on the top floor - which makes me wonder what would happen to people up there if there was a fire. And as for my room, where do I start? Well, the photos I have attached will tell some of the story...a thick layer of crud on the floor by the door, an absolutely filthy window and a splotch of something brown on the radiator with what appeared to be a pubic hair stuck in the middle of it. No chair. no water glass, a small portable TV with such dreadful reception that everyone's heads looked pointed, a badly cracked washbasin - oh, and speaking of the washbasin, it was so near the wardrobe that unless you were of Victoria Beckham proportions you couldn't even stand in front of it. The shared bathroom was two floors down, and looked like something you'd find in a prison in Eastern Europe. I could feel every spring in the mattress, and I am *still* itching from the awful blanket on the bed. Needless to say, I did not pay extra to eat breakfast there given the obvious lack of hygiene elsewhere in the hotel - oh, and they ask for a twenty pound deposit or your credit card details in case you run off with your room key. I scraped twenty pounds' worth of change together, because there was no way this scummy place was getting their hands on my credit card details! Absolutely dreadful place, and I can't suggest strongly enough that you give it a wide berth - except for Eli Roth, because it would be a perfect location for the next "Hostel" movie.

Reviews.Title: “ACK!”
Reviews.Author: Mrcyless
Reviews.Content: More of a hostel than a hotel. My friends were with me and they weren't allowed past the lobby! First I was on the third floor and there was no elevator. The stairwell was barely wide enough to fit my suitcase up. The room was smaller than most walk in closets. It was a cot with a blanket, a sink and a television with 2 channels on top of a kiddie sized desk. The bathroom was a floor down and it was SCARY!!! I know it's cheap but you will be very upset with yourself for staying here.

Reviews.Title: “A place for comfort and fun”
Reviews.Author: papasakuntu
Reviews.Content: I wanted a place to relax and have fun with a work colleague over the christmas period . And as I was flipping through the places I came across Belgrave House Hotel at Victoria, London. Their customer service, hygien and prices are second to none. I will never forget my time at Belgrave House Hotel. Not forgetting the beautiful receptionist- Ewa. Kisses. Hope you will be there when I visit again. God Bless Belgrave House Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I agree with Garyvikiessex, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: brittravEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: My wife & I checked in to this hotel, aiming to get a good night's comfortable sleep, after travelling to London by coach, before a very long international coach journey next day. The outside of the building was presentable, the reception area acceptable but the bedroom was totally unacceptable! In a professional capacity, I have seen better appointed prison cells than the room we were given! It was filthy, the ensuite smelly and the toilet seat loose, you could not see out of the windows they were so dirty and the bed linen looked not clean. Even the bed end fell to bits as we walked past it! When we raised this with the receptionist, all she could say was that this was a budget hotel and seemed to think that there was not a problem! In my book "budget" does not mean substandard! We met a German tourist in the reception area who had just checked in and was so horrified, she had checked straight out again, moving to an hotel across the street. We decided to do the same, rather than stay in this hellhole. The German tourist had been given a refund but the hotel receptionist ~ quite rightly ~ said that, as our contract was with Last Minute, she could not refund us and in any case the manager was not there so she did not have authority. We managed to check in to a perfectly acceptable hotel accross the road and got a fairly good night's sleep. Next morning I rang the Last Minute Helpline who said they could refund if the hotel would agree. They spoke to the manager who declined to refund, so we were out of pocket on this, having had to pay again for the second hotel. Our only consolation was that I knew there was a "review" section on to which we could put our feelings as a warning to other potential guests. I realised we were not dreaming when I read the Garryviki review! Don't know if you at Last Minute read these reviews in detail, but if you do, perhaps,you should take note of what said an perhaps take this particular establishment off yor list until such time as significant improvements can be shown!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: GaryVicki
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place we stay in. In fact we never even stayed, walked straight out and they never refunded our money. Its dirty and smelly, there was blood stain on the bed, I wouldn’t even let a dog stay there. That’s all I need to say on the matter keep well clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Jeff0123
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel for an overnight stay and then reading the reviews on here I showed up terrified, fully prepared to spend the night avoiding rats and dodging cockroaches. Check in was no problem, staff were friendly enough, then we made our way up an (admittedly narrow and shabby) set of stairs and corridors to our room. Was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, functional en suite (we'd been upgraded for free, we only paid for a basic double) devoid of anyone else's pubes/dirt/grime. Checked the bed, the mattress was a little uncomfortable but it was freshly made with clean sheets and a blanket and our "complimentary" bathroom was also fine. Went out for the evening and came back to catch a couple of hours sleep before heading back home and slept like a log, which as I light sleeper I normally find difficult. Didn't have the breakfast as we slept through it so can't comment on that, sorry! The hotel IS basic. It's not the Ritz but if you expect it to be for £40 a night for a double room in the centre of London then you are clearly off your trolley. It's true the entrance doesn't really represent the overall atmosphere of the hotel and that the corridors and stairs are dated, steep and narrow with no lift but if you can put up with this then you shouldn't have a problem, the rooms are clean. As to fire safety each floor had at least one fire extinguisher on it, (I checked) and all looked fairly new and functional. Despite its flaws, if I can manage to stay there (and I have quite the princess-complex when it comes to hotels), anyone with a realistic eye for a bargain, based on my experiences anyway, can't go wrong here. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, grotty rooms”
Reviews.Author: davenkim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night luckely. It location is goord just a very short walk from Victoria station. Its cheap and cheap for a reason, as they do not invest anything in the comfort of the guests. The hotel is a maze of corridors and stair cases which are not suitable for anyone with a disability. I would question the safety of the place, as there was at least 1 fire extinguisher missing from its location, the cleaning staff left bags of rubbish and dirty laundry at the top and bottom of stairs (a calim waiting to happen) The rooms are poorly decorated and appear dirty, I felt the need to wash my hands before using any of the light switches as they were caked in grime. The shared toilets and shower facilities were dirty. I could go on, but like the cleaners there.....I can't be bothered. Would I go back? No.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value Good, but what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: redlakes
Reviews.Content: I know there are several reviews slagging this place off, but we stayed in a twin room, for £32.50 per night per room for 3 nights in central London, just close to Victoria Coach station and main line station. If you are expecting luxury accomodation for that money go some where else. The outside and reception look nice, but as others have said it is not a true reflection of inside of the public areas and bedrooms, which are very basic. We didnt do breakfast as got allergies etc, so cant comment on that. However there is a microwave and fridge for guests use, and that prooved handy with a Sainsburys just down the road at Victoria Station. If you have ever back packed abroad and stayed in hostel type accomodation, this is what its like. As we we were out for all of the day, this place was purely as a base to sleep, and with clean sheets, and a bed, it served that purpose adequately for £16 each. If you want something a bit more than that, then you are going to have to pay more, or compromise on position and extra costs and time in travelling to central London, its thats simple. For the price and location its hard to beat, just dont set your expectations that high for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, dirty, over all a dump.”
Reviews.Author: TeddyPeng
Reviews.Content: The exterior and the reception area were lovely but as soon as you go up the stairs the nasty smells hit you along with the dirty carpets, walls etc. The room was small but bareable, the walls were dirty as was the floor. The worst thing about the room was the bed, it was noisy and so old that the springs were coming out and everytime we turned over they dug in. The location was good. Thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “More than wrost and nasty, It is a prison or grave not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: yumikooooo
Reviews.Content: We booked triple room en suite for 2 adults ,1 child for 2 nights. I have read negative reviews in this website before I went there but I was optimistic and thougth that I might be get a better room. But after check in I was realise that all negative reviews are correct. Started from very dirty carpet on stairwell. The room was damp and dirty in every ankle,I think I got the room that show in the hotel picture because every position is the same but not that clean. toilet floor very dirty, toilet curtian was mouldy like never clean for a year. bed very filtchy, spring nearly come out, my back was hurt,not comfortable at all. Cabinet and fridge very bad smell when opened. No kattle available, only one cloth hanger, TV remote didn't work. We complainted to receptionist but that guy said that it was very clean in his view point nothing wrong with the room. We asked for refund but he said that we need to write a complaint letter and leave it until manager come in but do not know when he will come. I could not sleep for the whole night because of noisy both from outside and inside of the hotel. I heard foot step and everything that guest in the room above have done. I wanted to scream, my son(6 years old) was cried. We decided to check out next morning and stay in at premier inn instead. Very angry they get my money. PLEASE DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL

Reviews.Title: “YUK!”
Reviews.Author: MammaAmenze
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY HERE! Beds were so uncomfortable that I couldn't sleep - the people that worked there was so rude and told me I could only change rooms (mine was so dirty) if I paid for an upgrade! Instead I just went and stayed in my friends room, which to be honest wasn't much better, but at least I wasn't alone in a creepy dirty room.

Reviews.Title: “My Visa card nr was stolen!”
Reviews.Author: Ciccinaa
Reviews.Content: The web page of the hotel looks really nice but the rooms aren´t. we only stayed for 2 nights and were out all day so we only slept there. We didn´t have it comfortable but it was Ok for the price (we only paid 40£/night for a dubble room!). The bad thing was that when I was booking the room and entered my Visa card nr someone (I don´t say it was the hotel) took my card nr! On the Januari statement from the bank I discovered that my card had been used for several high expenses (several bills was on 600 eur!) Fortunately I got everything back from the bank but it was all very stressful and uncomfortable. I don´t use my card on the internet except when I really have to and have not been using my card at all except for that time booking the hotel. I even thought it was strange the whole booking process so maybe a warning bell should have gone on. It didn´t work at first so I called the hotel and asked about the booking. The guy was quite rude and said that everything should be ok. I tried again and that time it worked. I even called the hotel again to confirm my reservation and it seemed to be ok. Anyway, maybe I was just unlucky but I just wanted to share my experience. If you want a very cheap hotel with a very good location and don´t have high expectations this hotel could be ok for a coupla of nights. If the thing with the card wouldn´t have happened maybe I could recommend this hotel. But since you only can book and pay on the internet I wouldn´t trust them again! If you book this hotel (or any other hotel over the net) check you account statements!

Reviews.Title: “Only a place to sleep, maybe”
Reviews.Author: clint123
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay for one night between our other hotel and friends' in the country as we were going to a party in the city. I arrived with my wife and 200 bags and noted the man in reception found it amusing to watch us struggle, but not necessary to help us get through the door or up the very tiny staircase. We had our own shower, most other rooms did not. It's fine for a night if you don't need to be in your room for any period, especially at the price. Any longer and you may go mad. Our lights worked, our neighbours' lights did not. Our bed was like a trampoline, but not the nice kind. No aircon, no cleaning and the breakfast amounted to toast. Okay for a crash house, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient. Cheap. Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: fkhsbc
Reviews.Content: Given my budget and my requirement to be close to the tube station, this place was perfect. If you're looking for the Ritz, dont' stay here. If you're looking for affordable accomodations in the heart of Central London, this is your place. Staying here allowed me to spend money on other stuff. London's expensive enough as it is. I don't need to drop $250/night just so I the tiles in my bathroom are of the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for your buck in London.”
Reviews.Author: johnnygunara
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were backpacking through Europe and came across this place in Central London. A 2 minute walk from the Victoria station tha takes you everywhere in London and close enough to Buckingham Palace and Picadily Circus where we could just walk if we wanted. Service was great. And the place was SUPER cheap. You can't even tell it's a 1-star hotel when you walk in. Would stay there again given its location, service, and price.

Reviews.Title: “It IS possible to have quality and affordability!”
Reviews.Author: faizal_karim
Reviews.Content: I was in London for a week this past August with some friends. We stayed at the Belgrave House Hotel and it was great! Friendly service, perfect location, clean rooms, and very affordable!! Will certainly stay here next time I'm in London. They served breakfast every morning and provided Wi-Fi access to internet.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here under any circumstances”
Reviews.Author: katebush
Reviews.Content: easily the worst hotel i ever stayed in. the first room I was shown into was basically a dosshouse bedsit - a scruffy, unusable kitchen with a put-you-up bed. the second bedroom I was given as an alternative (with shared bathroom despite paying for ensuite) lacked the oven but had nose-pickings on he wall by the bed to compensate. The matress was stained and broken, and there was a single (brown!) blanket on the bed. The hotel is dangerous and must transgress every health and safety regulation going. It''s truly appalling and despite arriving at midnight I was tempted to try to find another hotel - even walking the streets seemed a viable option. Staff however were not unfriendly and seemed to be trying to do their best in appalling circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Never go here. Even if you're tempted by the price. Just don't”
Reviews.Author: Generic_Screen_Name1
Reviews.Content: This is the most digusting hotel I have ever had the misfortune to stay in. I was only there one night and that was enough. The room was disgusting and dirty. I was afraid to sleep in the bed it was that disgusting. No-one there understood a word of english. We were given the wrong times for breakfast so when we went down there in the morning at 8.55 and at 9.05 (after sitting there for 10 minutes) were told in an extremely rude mannor that we were not allowed breakfast as it was after the alloted time. We were told 9.30! Its was absolutely rediculous. Justy don't go there. Pay the extra money and get a half-decent nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: DaveyBoyWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month, and after reading the reviews before I booked, i thought that this place would be a modern day "Fawlty Towers". I only booked because of how cheap the place was, and was pretty chuffed at the end of my stay. The rooms are really basic and lack alot of amenities. But then again, this is a budget bdget hotel, and they dont make any claims to be anything other than. Its location is faultless, the hotel is clean, and the service is pretty standard - no concierge here!!!! I would definitely stay again, and would recomend this place if you are after a few nights of cheap sleep, and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: sandycj
Reviews.Content: avoid this hotel if you possibly can ! it's cheap and very nasty ! reception was clean and thats where it ends! rooms were very small we didn't use the bathroom or shower both were very dirty in dire need of a referb ! as did the room all very tired looking !! beds were awful ! felt every spring! no matress or pillow protectors although clean sheets ? curtains at windows need re-hanging !! we stayed one night thank god ! breakfast was supposed to be "continental" on offer corn flakes or bran flakes and toast ? the room itself was very small and more like a works canteen ! we wanted a glass of water but were given a pot of HOT water ??? The reception staff were quite rude when we asked if we could leave our luggage after arriving early ! basically no was the response ! the luggage room itself is a tiny tiny cupboard !! One good point !! it's close to the theatre's- train and tube !! Value for money !! absolutely not !! please please take this review seriously and STAY away

Reviews.Title: “very very bad service !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 76rotterdam
Reviews.Content: As we came arrived at the hotel at 22.30 with our reservation, the hotel told us they cancelled the reservation, withhout letting us know! We had to search for another hotel at night at twice the price, two spoiled days! After several complaints the never even get back in contact with us. SO PLEASE NEVER BOOK A ROOM IN THIS HOTEL YOU WON'T BE SURE TO HAVE IT

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: johnsarah25
Reviews.Content: We book the hotel from their website at a very cheap prices. Quite Surprise for what you get when you come. Everything is included included the breakfast. For £35.00 i could not expect more. I have to say, the hotel is very basic and Public bathroom need to be redone. Room were clean and this is what is the most important.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap 'N' Nasty”
Reviews.Author: DOLLYDIMPLEScotland
Reviews.Content: Please, please take notice, I know money is tight for most of us but don't be lured by this so called hotel. I needed a break & thought that this hotel would be ok, as most of the time I would be site seeing & the rooms can't be that bad. WHAT A MISTAKE...! I have never experienced anything like it. The room was grubby, the staff unfriendly, the breakfast room appeared ok. Aha I thought good until I tried the coffee, I think they made it the night before (it was more for surfacing the roads). The toast was probably reduced bread from a few days earlier. My window looked onto a roof from downstairs, it was littered with cigarette buts & pigeon crap, I'm sure the beds had bugs as I came out in a huge rash which was very painfull. When you went to voice your concerns, don't bother no one understands you. So please fellow travelers, AVOID, AVOID, AVOID.........!

Reviews.Title: “Borat's Brothel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ravpan
Reviews.Content: This should definately be in the Top 10 Worst Hotels in Europe!! Its an experience one can only describe as shocking and unreal! My room was basically up 3 flights of narrow stairs (no lift) and on entrance to my abode I witnessed pure horror; celiing covered in crap, a smell in the air that can only be descibed as dust mixed with sweat plus guests in the shape of bedbugs! It also had a square box with visible springs which must have been the bed, the window was single glazed and filled with muck and fossilised animals, the lock on the door was flimsy and falling apart, the bathroom looked like something out of a third world country and the staff were definately illegal immigrants...which is surprising as the UK Passport Office was only over the road! I think this is definately not a 'hotel', but more a 'half-way house' for illegal immigrants that are trying to get UK Residency! My company booked for me to stay there....suffice to say I no longer work for that company no more!!! Its definately BORATS BROTHEL!!

Reviews.Title: “dont call the police if ur room when ransacked, they not interested”
Reviews.Author: damolcfc
Reviews.Content: take heed from the advice here!! we stopped here due to working close by, its not a hotel, its a bedsit for eastern europeans ( no disrespect to eastern europeans) people live there. u have to share bathrooms with people that live here, their shower gel, shaving and toothpaste are all lined up in the bathrooms. dont not use room36a its a basement room next to the resturant..... haha resturant, ok woteva.... ours got broken into, no body could speak english, the police didnt care and the cctv only works in reception when u have 2 very upset and angry guests who shout at the receptionist. £35 per room is £35 for a reason....ask to see ur room b4 u take it....i promise u...its so worth it...dont waste ur time asking for an upgrade either....rooms are all the same take care please...learn by other peoples mistakes

Reviews.Title: “Please do not go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fozzie14
Reviews.Content: Please do not go under any circumstances other than you have only the streets as an alternative. i have stayed in budget hotels and know the score. i do expect clean sheets and not curly hairs on them! this is for starters. my friends and i were worried we might fall asleep and wake up in another country after being sold! dirty, grime, skanky everything! odd rooms, NOT LIKE ANY OF THE PICTURES!!!!! please believe - we did not sleep here - ended up getting train home!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place i've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: dhyndi
Reviews.Content: without a doubt the worst place i have ever stayed in my life!!!!!! Ok, it was budget prices, but you would at least expect humanitarian conditions to stay in!!!! the boiler broke on the friday when we turned up, and they weren't gettin git fixed until monday, a whole weekend with no hot water and freezing rooms! so much so a group of spanish tourists called the police to try and get their money back! - ended up they told us they would give us £10 per night back, which was rubbish - for the 3 nights i stayed i got £10! If you where going to london with pets i wouldn't even reccommend here for them!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LespaKent
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i booked after looking at the hotel website through MarvellousHotels.com. Nothing prepared us for what we got. We went for the New Years Eve celebrations and although only for 1 night we had difficulty persuading ourselves to stay in the room. Tiny, cramped, smelling of damp!! One blanket on the bed which had 'gaffer' tape round ends of frame. Pest control box under the bedside table and the shower room - cannot descrbe it, only to say we did not shower the next morning, needed a health warning!!! Must admit only needed one blanket as the heating was on full blast and unable to control it!! The tiny TV did not work properley, not even a mug in bathroom for cleaning teeth. The Hotel was full due to time of year so could not get another room. Do not be fooled by the website photos. Yes the outside and reception are great - the rest, well just dont go there! This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in and spoilt what should have been great time

Reviews.Title: “A complete dump”
Reviews.Author: xoverdramatickissx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace. When we arrived, about an hour after 1pm (apparent check in time) our 'family' room has still not been cleaned. Upon investigation, we found over flowing bins, dirty and stained sheets, mouldy food in the fridge and, much to our disgust, pubic hair all over the bathroom floor. We were a group of two young men and two young women, myself being 20 years old. I marched downstairs to complain, was met with a very unhelpful and arrogant receptionist who informed me I could not speak to a manager as there wasn't one at the weekend. I demanded a refund, was shouted and sworn at, at which we left the hotel and walked up and down the street around the hotel, looking for alternative accomodation. We knew it was not going to be a palace, but what we found was worse than a prison! DO NOT STAY AT THE BELGRAVE HOUSE HOTEL! I have stayed in youth hostels which are cleaner and have more helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Prison-like Belgrave House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: critical-scott
Reviews.Content: The hotel on first impressions seemed ok, the bedroom was like a prison cell with only a single blanket to keep you warm. The bed was a fold down camp bed & the pillows were so lumpy that I had to support my head with my coat. The mattress had springs coming through which were proding your body. My room was on the main stair-well, this meant I was woken up almost on a nightly basis with people having to pass my room. The toilet was smelly, unclean & in a terrible state of repair. The toilet very seldom flushed properly. The staff were unfriendly, almost bodering on untrusting. I would not recommend this youth hostel type of hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Grave House”
Reviews.Author: KayLagos
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my wife from 19-22nd Oct. 2008. The front reception is the only good looking place in this so called hotel. They decieve people with a large screen tv that never works. The rooms are so small and with spring beds!. There was no toilet roll in my toilet. They did not put on the heater despite their promises that the boiler would switch on at 8.30 pm daily. On our last night, it was horrible. There was blood all over the hotel bathroom and the hotel staff were alerted in the night but nothing was done to clean it until about 9.30 am in the morning. For any complaint, the answer is that the place is for only bed and breakfast and they should not be bothered. The breakfast was basic with unfriendly staff at work.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you expect”
Reviews.Author: Achilles24
Reviews.Content: As others have stated the staff aren't particularly friendly, but if you are looking for somewhere cheap and easy to stay in a convenient location, then this hotel will certainly meet your requirements.

Reviews.Title: “The 'Basic' Belgrave”
Reviews.Author: RealisticOxford
Reviews.Content: Was dreading what I would find having read reviews! Yes it was basic,yes it was a bit "youth hostelly" but I paid £129.00 for 2 nights with my daughter and that included theatre tickets! Reviewers get over yourselves! V. Cox Oxford.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: welshnana
Reviews.Content: this hotel needs a good clean and the staff need to learn some manners.electric sockets hanging of walls,mould in bathroom,pigeon muck on window sills [inside the room],toilet rocking while you sat on it,dirty linen[never changed in the 4 days we were there]light kept flickering on and off.good points the reception and dining room was nice as was the front of the hotel.we had a lovely time in london and only used the hotel to sleep in.if the cleaners and maintenise people done there job properly this would be a lovely hotel.would i stay here again maybe as it was cheap and in a grat location.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap not cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: madosani
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to london for her 16th Birthday. On arrival we were greeted by the receptionist who was very friendly, giben our key and directions, well, heavy case and 58 steps later we got to our room. It was basic, tv and 2 beds with a pod style ensuite, (which was clean) the room was clean although probably could do with a repaint soon. the floor was laminated and clean. The beds were a bit old, matress was cheap but I slept ok (i have back problem and it did not get worse) but the pillow was a joke! I think they forgot to put them in the pillow case. Could not get any more seemed to be a language barrier at this point. Bedding is clean sheets and one doubled over blanket, although warm enough did not look very inviting. Breakfast was far too mad! we went down both mornings at about 8.30 and could not get in the room. we ended up eating in starbucks. On checking out we left cases in luggage cupboard, reclaiming them later with no problem. Possibly would use again but will have lighter case!

Reviews.Title: “sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: beefyAttard
Reviews.Content: Absolute no go. Only the reception area is well decorated. the hotel is run by foreign expats who hardly know english. the reception guy was very rude, even passing wind whilst i was talking to him. to get to my room i had to climb a narrow staircase then go down again, then go through a a narrow corridor. room secured by a padlock. the bed was hopeless with springs going throughthe mattress. the central heating not working. hotel staff provided an electric fan. breakfast consists of hot water/coffee and a plain toast. i tried to get out but they would not give a refund. otherwise shower very clean and hotel very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Belgrave House”
Reviews.Author: mort80
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the BHH. The room was cozy (small). I received fresh linens everyday, had a shared bath, but never waited to use it. The price was right, cheaper than any other place near where I wanted to stay in London. The people at the front desk were very polite and helpful. The breakfast was a little on the weak side. Toast, coffee, and cereal were all I needed to start the day. The layout of the hotel was a little strange, no elevator and narrow staircases, but after a full day in London, a few more steps were not a problem. I would gladly stay there again. The price along with the location made this a good value. If you are looking for a safe and affordable place to stay in London, near a transportation hub(Victoria Station is less than a 5 minute walk) you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here!”
Reviews.Author: blueskysFrance
Reviews.Content: had booked to stay here for two nights, turned up the first evening,to be showed a dirty room, TV did not work and to top it all found bed bugs on the pillow! Went straight back to the reception with one of the bugs, and asked to be moved, only to be told there was no other room available for that night would have to sleep there and would be moved the next day, the man on reception took the bug said he would show the management, i think he just throw it away! I left to find something to eat feeling very down the thought of spending a night with bed bugs was just too much, luckly i found a hotel just down the road, and he had one single left, he showed me the room which was fantastic, they have just been totally refurbished and beautifully done and I was only charged £43 per night with full english breakfast. So went back to the other hotel to tell them i could not stay, and would like some sort of refund only to be told I would have to come back the next day to speak to the manager who would be there at 9;00 am. Went back as told at 9.00, only to be treated like dirt by a new girl on the reception, who had been warned i was coming in, she shouted at me and was rude said there was nothing wrong with their rooms and that the manager is never in on a sunday, as if i had made it all up. Anyway she called up the housekeeper, and demanded i went down to the room with her, to be shown there was nothing wrong, the TV still did not work the room still was dirty, as for the bugs well day time they do not come out, I asked her if she would pay to stay in this room, she said no,we then went back to the reception, to confront the girl on the desk, her answer was i had to write a letter to the management, to demande a refund, as she could not do so. I get the feeling I will never see my money back. DO NOT STAY HERE it should be closed down, if you are looking for a cheap place to stay thats clean go to the St Georges hotel down the road the normal price for a single is £45 worth every penny and more.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't even stay one night!”
Reviews.Author: JCONRAD
Reviews.Content: The guy on reception was ignorant on every level, most unpleasant after a long flight from Thailand. When we saw the sub-standard dirty room we asked to be moved & were told that no other room was available. So we decided to leave. We asked for the manager's name & were refused it! So we left & found a much nicer hotel. Eventually got the money refunded through lastminute. A bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: randj13
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying in the Belgrave House Hotel. You walk into the reception and think " well yes this looks fine". Leave your aspirations there because it just went down hill FAST. Opened the door to the room and thought "Oh my God" Forget the pictures on the website. Was met with a view of filthy windows which looked out into the rear-paintwork was so badly neglected the wood was bare and lifted.Bed looked ok ,with a cobbled together sink unit in the corner,an open box which was supposed to be a wardrobe and a separate loo in which the tiles were broken anydwas minute. Thought ok it was only for one night. Returned to hotel after midnight and went to bed 2 of the thinnest pillows and 2 blankets on bed AND NO HEATING. Put excuse for a heater on and ended up putting our coats on the bed to try and get warm. (It was too cold to go and complain). Breakfast consisted of orange juice cornflakes and toast. (no choices of juice or cereal). Luckily the rest of our short trip to London was fantastic and would recommend the show Buddy and a restaurant on Buckingham Palace Rd called Bumbles top notch 3 course meal for £10!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: vzjs79
Reviews.Content: Me and 6 friends stayed in this hotel for the weekend, and the hotel was basic and a bit dirty, but I was bitten by bed bugs and ended up bringing them home with me. I have contacted the hotel several times to complain and I have never received any acknowledgement nor any apology. This hotel is cheap for a reason!!. The area was good and there is an easy hotel a couple of doors down. STAY THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by Belgrave House Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gacorey1
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel if comfort is of any importance to you. The mattresses were old, thin, and comprised of nothing but springs covered by some fabric. Consequently, you can feel every spring on your back. In three nights, I did not get a single good night's sleep because every time I would move, the springs rudely reasserted their presence abruptly waking me from my slumber. Additionally, the "double bed" my companion and I requested was two single beds pushed together, which is okay, but the configuration only added to the discomfort. They really shouldn't have bothered with the pillows considering they were about as thin as the sheet. At a minimum, this hotel should invest in some decent pillows to improve the service to their guests. Although, the rooms are non-smoking, a subtle but unpleasant odor of cigarette smoke permeated the room. We had an ensuite room, but the bathroom was so small, it was difficult to even turn around in it. It looked like one of those prefabricated bathrooms made for RVs, which was stuck into a corner in the hotel room. We had a TV, but one day it didn't work at all, and the other days, it received only four channels with pretty poor reception, two of which seemed to be airing darts tournaments 24/7. Beyond the lobby, the corridors and rooms look run down - do not believe the photos on the hotel website, which make it look modern and minimalist. Breakfast was spartan - choice of brown flakes or cornflakes, coffee or tea, and white toast with butter and jam, but I suppose that is to be expected with the cheap rate. Despite its numerous shortcomings, this hotel has two things going for it: Location, and cleanliness (as far as I could tell). So if you are on a budget and don't mind discomfort, this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible beds”
Reviews.Author: adventureteam
Reviews.Content: Although this place is convenient, cheap, and fairly clean, if you don't like springs piercing your body all night-this is not the place for you. We spent 4 nights there-2 nights in one room and 2 nights in another room. We shared our room with friends and between all of these beds and rooms we did not get one remotely comfortable bed. It literally hurt to sleep due to the springs poking through and jabbing your body. Very uncomfortable. I have spent many nights camping and slept in various cheap youth hostels, but these beds take the prize for worst ever. Breakfast was also less than desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good prices”
Reviews.Author: Hotelgaest
Reviews.Content: Belgrave House Hotel has an excellent location with walking distances to a lot of places. Victoria St. is just around the corner. The hotel has a friendly staff, which is very helpful. I upgraded myself to a nice doubleroom with shower for at few extra pounds a day! The included breakfast with toast, coffee/tea and cereals is a fine start each day. The small, goodlooking lobby is wellprovided with brochures, maps and leaflets for all the sights and museums in London and area. The lobby has also automats in which you can buy soft drinks, beer, chips and chocolate. Some of the rooms are a bit worn out, but they are clean and good. I will properly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as people Say”
Reviews.Author: bbhalifax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, and don't expect the Ritz, but the staff are friendly, its a chance for you to experience the real "london" and not the cookie cutter hotel experience (depends on what you like, I guess). There are shared bathroom facilities, and some rooms have their own shower inside, and when I stayed (4 nights in total) the bathrooms were always kept nice and clean, the beds were comfy with clean sheets, and I felt safe. Might I mention as well LOCATION! Its is just seconds away (on foot) from Victoria Station, shopping malls, bars/pubs, coffee shops, restaurants, theatre (for musicals, etc.), etc. etc. etc. Also close by (like a five minute walk or so) is Buckingham Palace and the Queens Gallery (please go see this Art work its AMAZING). So, for younger travelers or couples, this is a bargin and not only will you save money on your accomodations, you will save money on transportation too! PS Although we didn't get up early enough - breakfast is included in your stay at the Belgrave House Hotel too! That also saves some money! So, if you are wanting to go to London on a budget, this is the place for you. I've stayed at 5 star resorts in Jamaica before and at the best hotels, and really, as long as the bed is clean/room is clean, its safe, and in a GREAT spot, you can't go wrong. I gave the Belgrave an above average because you can't beat friendly service and a great location. The staff there let us stow our luggage and took it to our rooms for us (we arrived very early in the morning) so we could go site-seeing and not miss a day waiting around or dragging heavy luggage about. They offer any help they can give, and are very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is actually a large house/manner rennovated into a hotel, and lots of floors (no elevator) but not hard to find way around. Hope this review helps. PS go see the musical "Chicago" you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Concept Hotel gets basics wrong”
Reviews.Author: Fruit99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. We were attracted by the good location and the no frills concept. Why pay more for all the friperies. Unfortunately, this hotel has got the basics wrong. For me, the minimum requirement is a comfortable and warm bed.... However, the bed frame screeched with every move, the matress had seen better days and I could feel the individual springs in my back, the pillow was approx 1cm thick giving my husband neck problems, and the sheet and blanket were insufficient to keep us warm through the night. After three sleepless nights, we were extremely happy to get back to our own bed. The rest of the hotel is fine - clean, but tired in some areas - very new in others. Breakfast was basic but sufficient. But I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: Missmelina
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room on a website before visiting London.Worst hotel i have ever experienced there.Though it was mentionned on the website this hotel has been totally refurbished, i ended up in a small single room on the last floor with tricky stairs.Room was unclean and damp, with ceiling full of mould which was in a rather scary state, there was a noise of flowing water coming from room's next door al night, tv was not working properly, only one shared bathroom was gloomy and 2 floor downstairs. Staff was awfully rude and unfriendly, from eastern europe with hardly the basis of grammatical english : they also refused to serve me the included-in-price breakfast at 9 am in the morning, pretending it was too late, the waitress just made strange signs with her hands to me when i tried to get in the room for breakfast, like she would try to take away a dog that would steal in garbage/trashcan.I was shocked and complained to management, which didnt pay attention at all and left without having my breakfast,without having slept or excuses or refund.DO NOT EVER GO THERE, this place is dangerous with electric plugs too and should close down to my opinion ...

HotelInfo.Name: Belgrave House Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 28-32 Belgrave Road | Victoria, London SW1V 1RG, England
